definition: to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: DA 's dad: (Shaking KS's hand and whispering) Take good care of her.
sentences.chinese: 丹父和江石握手把女兒交託給他。

sentences.english: Only after this “handshaking” is complete can the exchange of data commence.
sentences.chinese: 只有經過這樣一個“握手”後，數據交換才能開始。

sentences.english: A shake hands as you say good-bye and thank the interviewer for spending time with you.
sentences.chinese: 道別時要握手感謝僱主花時間面試你。

sentences.english: I stood and smiled and offered Jeanine a handshake.
sentences.chinese: 我笑着站了起來，並伸手出去和珍妮握手告別。

sentences.english: The boss is delighted, he's been all over the works dishing out bonuses and handshakes.
sentences.chinese: 老闆高興了，他走遍全廠分發紅包，與每個人握手。

sentences.english: He stretched and shook with me.
sentences.chinese: 他伸出手和我握了握手。

sentences.english: The businessmen shook hands after signing the contract.
sentences.chinese: 實業家們簽完合同之後相互握手。

sentences.english: I am saying good bye and shaking your hands.
They shook and greeted with each other.
sentences.chinese: 他們握了握手，互致問候。

sentences.english: It uses a three-packet handshake in which both the sender and receiver agree that they are ready to communicate.
sentences.chinese: 它使用三次握手機制保證通信雙方都準備好進行通信。

sentences.english: It took me six weeks to train the dog to shake hands.
sentences.chinese: 訓練狗寶寶握手用了我六週的時間。

sentences.english: As a sign of friendship, Gordon and Peter clasped hands.
sentences.chinese: 爲了象徵友誼，高頓和彼德互相握手。

sentences.english: Usually they do not shake hands when they just meet or say goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 如果只是遇見或是道別時，通常他們是不會握手的。

sentences.english: He slept in the back of the car and made handshake deals.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他就睡在車後座，跟別人達成握手協議。

sentences.english: Interview etiquette extends beyond the goodbye hand-shake.
sentences.chinese: 面試禮儀不僅限於臨別握手。

sentences.english: Then he said he had an appointment and had to go, so we shook hands and said goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 後來他說他還有個約會必須走了，我們握手道別。

definition: to greet sb by word or action/to give prior notice
to send one's greetings/to send best regards/to devote attention to
to say hello to/to send one's regards to
to exchange conventional greetings/to talk about the weather
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
to exchange conventional greetings/to exchange pleasantries
to clap one's hands/to clap each other's hands/high five
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
